TopicTitle: Missing or invalid parts while loading crafts in VAB

Articles.Content: When playing with mods sometimes parts get lost, when you delete or update mods. Is there a way to find out, which parts are missing?

First thing I would check when updating a mod is the change log. Most (or all) mods have a change log either on their front page here, in the zip archive or on the download site. Any removing of parts should be mentioned there.

There is a way to find what parts are missing and possibly removing them (which may cause glitches). Firstly load the craft up in the VAB (yes, I know it won't load), when it gives you the part error write down the exact names for those parts. Then go to your KSP install location and go to the Saves folder. Then go to your saved game name, into the building you saved the craft (so it should look like [KSP Install]>Saves>[Save Name]>VAB or SPH). Open the craft file in notepad and hit ctrl+f to open the find window. Then use the search feature to find that part. Here's where the bugs come in, if you carefully delete that entire part, it might let you reuse the craft but again, expect bugs.

:Like @ZooNamedGames games says, the game will tell you which specific part is missing.  If the ship was in flight, you'll get the message as soon as the game loads you to the KSC view.  If you're trying to load a ship in the VAB or SPH, it will tell you then.  Then you have a choice.  You can either do like he said and delete the part from the ship in your save file (either manual as above or with the KML savefile editor mod).  Or, you can just reinstall that mod.
